news_header: UK regulators are considering loosening mortgage lending rules and removing the £100 cap on contactless payments to boost the economy.
news_text: The UK's Financial Conduct Authority (FCA) is exploring ways to simplify mortgage lending rules established after the 2008 financial crisis to enhance access to home loans. This move follows a request from Prime Minister Sir Keir Starmer and other officials for reforms to stimulate economic growth. The FCA is also contemplating removing the £100 limit on contactless card transactions. While lenders support these potential changes, concerns remain about ensuring consumer protection and the lessons learned from past financial crises.
